Avoreen's Masterful Dagger (Rogue 33 / Fighter 6 / SD 1)


Image source: https://farm6.static.flickr.com/5136/54 ... 9a2a_b.jpg

This little happy chappy aims to 'stick the dagger in' so to speak, with as much sneak attack as possible, with some backup with WS/EWS, UMD and traps to deal with the sneak immunes that we all know and love.

With 20d6 sneak attack, improved two-weapon fighting, base AB 42 and BAB 26 for up to 6 attacks/round (7 APR with haste), if given the opportunity he will certainly do this.

He aims to create opportunities for this sneaky damage through stealth, improved knockdown, disable traps, darkness/ultravision from UMD, UMD summons/teammates for flanking, and eventually hide in plain sight. 

Even with a pebble flung from a sling he is potentially lethal with 20d6 sneak attack, ranged base 40 AB and HiPS.

His weaknesses include being knocked down himself (so knockdown immunity will be mandatory), and his fortitude / will saves, so death immunity belts & UMD for prot v evil / lesser mind blank / mind blank / clarity potions will be very valuable to make this guy protected.

In an environment where such things are available which includes a party I envisage he would be a monster.

He has nearly 400hp which is pretty good considering 33 levels of d6 hit die, and this could be capped at over 600hp.

Additionally epic dodge, uncanny dodge VI (only a dedicated rogue is likely to sneak attack him), evasion with a reflex save of 32 makes him tough to kill. 

Naked AC is 30 and a large shield can be added for extra defense (in a +5 environment this adds +7 AC).

He can be any alignment you wish, for this example I chose Chaotic Good because it suits his personality better, but those who wish to be smite immune can choose True Neutral.

Piles of skill points, I've chosen stealth, dual detection, search, disable/retrieval of epic traps, setting deadly/epic traps, crafting deadly traps, some crossclass spellcraft to help with the saves. And UMD and Tumble of course.

Was surprised I haven't seen much in the archives that go quite so rogue heavy (ie 30+) with these class combinations, some of which looked like they needed a little polishing. Some were elves, one chap admitted he hadn't playtested his build before posting.

I'm keen not to make the same mistake as the other fellow and try to follow the rules, so I've put this up for your review in the build draft section (unfinished builds), mostly from not really play-testing this guy, but I have a good feeling this fellow will do quite well.

This little chap is probably sufficiently different with dual wielding daggers, higher fortitude score, different skill layout. My dex is 2 points lower but my str and cons are both 2 points higher.

I'll keep this here in the unfinished builds section for now.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
If you go 16 Ro / 4 Fighter pre-epic and take your 4 Fighter levels early (Levels 2,3,4,5) you net a couple of desirable things in my opinion.
1. You net more feats earlier exchanging Evade and Uncanny Dodge for Weapon Specialisation (more early damage on a dex build) and getting other combat feats earlier.  It will make levelling a little easier, that is pretty early for NPCs that require Evade and Epic Dodge and you have disarm trap and open lock for locks and traps.
2. You net +2 more Reflex Saves on a build with no +save class multi

I also tend to push two weapon fighting out a bit and pull general combat feats early as starting out dual wielding is extra hard on a 3/4 AB build.  Usually you are running around in medium armor with a shield for a bit until your AB and magic bonuses catch up.

This is a feat tight class, taking Blind Fight in Epics is ... challenging making dual wield a little less savory.  I would likely pull blind fight back into pre-epics and push improved two weapon fighting out to where Blind fight is currently.  Alternatively, a couple more (4) Pre-Epic Fighter levels would sort this out and net more Fortitude and another +1 AB.  I would then, strongly consider swapping that spare feat AND Epic Prowess for 2x Great Dex netting another AC, a further Dex modifier to your skills and of course returning the lost Epic Prowess AB, or perhaps Armor Skin.  I completely understand if you want preserve the 33 Rogue levels mind you as that is the focus of the build.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Nice comments Zanithar

The focus is on sneak damage, and I agree on the blind fight being a bit late.

More fighter levels early would get all those lovely feats like BF / IKD / ITWF earlier as you say.

Rogue 3 early on is nice for the 2d6 sneak attack, evasion, uncanny dodge and skills I like to go rogue - 2 fighter levels - 2 rogue levels to start off with, if that makes any sense. Then Fighter 3-4 for WS, then some alternating sneak / feats.

Redone the build to a Rogue 29 / Fighter 10 / SD 1 class split which gets everything earlier. Still has base AB 42, Sneak attack 20d6, dex is now 30. Has more 20 more skill points as I pump int up higher to compensate for the fighter levels. Has a little more HP to just go over 400.

Looks better in my view! Thank you for commenting!
